item.title: Cycling the Burke Gilman Trail in Seattle
item.description: While living in Seattle, I rode to and from Fremont every day on the Burke Gilman bike trail. Little did I knowm that everytime a pedestrian or bicycle travels on the BG trail north of NE 70th St, they were counted by wires in a diamond formation in the concrete. Since this data is publicly available online, I decided to explore usage of the Burke Gilman trail and see what trends lay within.
